trustfund:
TF026814-PHRD-FYR MACEDONIA: HEALTH
            SECTOR DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Health Sector Management
            Project for Macedonia, former Yugoslav Republic of were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            close coordination of policy lending and investment lending
            can greatly facilitate achievement of reforms. Although the
            policy lending included reforms across several sectors,
            there was a sustained sector focus on health that was
            central to achieving important synergies with the investment
            operations. Political obstacles can be overcome with
            effective planning and consultation, but will be
            insurmountable otherwise. The project manager should be
            chosen by agreement between the Bank and the Ministry of
            Health (MOH) as a bridge person, someone with political
            access but who is not reporting and subject to the MOH on a
            daily basis. Information technology (IT) components of
            health sector reform frequently encounter delays, whose risk
            can be mitigated through careful planning and flexibility.
            Qualified regional experts can be extremely effective as
            consultants and trainers. These consultants also contributed
            important demonstration effects of successful reform in
            other parts of the region.
